WorkItem.Description:
From thread: (posted by Cosiller)
http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=47708
Â 
I have noticed that the source files are in both UNIX and DOS formats.
It took me some time to find out why the scripts were running perfectly on my test server and after uploading via ftp to the production server were breaking at some points for (at first) no reason at all.
WorkItem.Summary: Source files are in both UNIX and DOS formats

Comments.Message:
Per section "File Formats" in the PEAR Manual for Coding Standards we should stick with UNIX line endings, that is LF
http://pear.php.net/manual/en/standards.file.php

If you agree with this, I will take care of converting files.
Some files didn't have a terminating LF character, also fixing that at the same time.
